text.p: Following are some of the main
stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified
these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HET FINANCIEELE DAGBLAD
- Amsterdam AEX-index breaks through 900-mark for the first
time, but ends at 897.10. (p1)
- Philips Electronics is in talks about selling
part of German electronics company Grundig . (p1)
- Dutch Post and telecoms group PTT Nederland is
looking for a buyer to take over its autolease unit. (p1)
- Government agrees to allow insurers to lure customers by
giving gifts, offering to return provisions. (p1)
- Small and medium-sized firms poised for further sales
growth. (p5)
DE VOLKSKRANT
- Dutch rail NS's rival Lovers Rail gets financial support
of France's Compagnie Generale d'Enterprise Automobile (CGEA).
- Transshipment companies ECT , ,
and Deka take over rival Bell Lijn. (p2)
- Labour shortage leads temp agency Randstad to
start experiment hiring temps on a permanent basis. (p6)
DE TELEGRAAF
- Number of Dutch people worried about the environment is
decreasing, according to central statistics office CBS. (p8)
- Bourse watchdog STE starts investigation on stockholders
who have not yet reported their stake in their own company.
TROUW
- Share options schemes turn managers into risky money-
grabbing entrepreneurs, says Amsterdam university professor A.
Boot. (p1)
- Union FNV keeps interfering with retailer Ahold's international staff policy. (p7)
ALGEMEEN DAGBLAD
- Cabinet will give the green light for extension of
Rotterdam harbour. (p11)
--Amsterdam newsdesk +31-20-504-5000
